item.title: Humidity sucks. Transaera has a new way to deal with it
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The startup's core technology is a proprietary material that absorbs moisture from the air, allowing air conditioning to cool buildings more efficiently.

item.title: YouTube is testing a sleep timer on its Premium tier
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
YouTube's latest test involves a sleep timer that pauses the video after, well, a set period of time.

item.title: Ola Electric surges 20% in India’s biggest listing in two years
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Ola Electric, India’s largest electric two-wheeler maker, surged by 20% on its public debut on Friday, making it the biggest listing among Indian firms in two years. Shares of the Bengaluru-based firm, which counts SoftBank and Temasek among its backers, jumped to ₹91.20 (about $1.1) after starting to trade at ₹76, the higher end of […]

item.title: Rocket Lab’s sunny outlook bodes well for future constellation plans
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Rocket Lab surpassed $100 million in quarterly revenue for the first time, a 71% increase from the same quarter of last year. This is just one of several shiny accomplishments executives showed off to investors on Thursday — and a good omen for the space company’s medium-term ambitious plans. Executives continued to tease plans for […]

item.title: CloudPay, a payroll services provider, lands $120M in new funding
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
In 1996, two companies, Patersons HR and Payroll Solutions, formed a venture called CloudPay to provide payroll and payments services to enterprise clients. CloudPay grew quietly over the next several decades, adding workflow automation features to maintain pace with upstart rivals. It’s still growing, CFO Andy Thomson assures TechCrunch. Thomson claims that CloudPay is handling […]

item.title: Security bugs in ransomware leak sites helped save six companies from paying hefty ransoms

item.description:
The vulnerabilities allowed one security researcher to peek inside the leak sites without having to log in.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
The tech layoff wave is still going strong in 2024. Following significant workforce reductions in 2022 and 2023, this year has already seen 60,000 job cuts across 254 companies, according to independent layoffs tracker Layoffs.fyi. Companies like Tesla, Amazon, Google, TikTok, Snap and Microsoft have conducted sizable layoffs in the first months of 2024. Smaller-sized […]

item.title: Rabbit’s r1 refines chats and timers, but its app-using ‘action model’ is still MIA
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
A new "beta rabbit" mode adds some conversational AI chops to the Rabbit r1, particularly in more complex or multi-step instructions.

item.title: Archer to set up air taxi network in LA by 2026 ahead of World Cup
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Los Angeles is notorious for its back-to-back traffic. Three events that promise to bring in millions of spectators from around the world — the 2026 World Cup, the Super Bowl in 2027 and the 2028 Olympics — have LA officials searching for a range of new mobility solutions to address its congestion problems. But they’re […]

item.title: Amazon is fumbling in India

item.description:
Amazon's decision to overlook quick-commerce in India is now looking like a significant misstep.

item.title: OpenAI finds that GPT-4o does some truly bizarre stuff sometimes
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI’s GPT-4o, the generative AI model that powers the recently launched alpha of Advanced Voice Mode in ChatGPT, is the company’s first trained on voice as well as text and image data. And that leads it to behave in strange ways sometimes — like mimicking the voice of the person speaking to it or randomly […]

item.title: Box adds crucial piece to its AI platform with Alphamoon acquisition
item.dc:creator: Ron Miller
item.description:
On Thursday, Box filled in a missing piece on its AI platform when it bought automated metadata extracting startup, Alphamoon.

item.title: OpenAI adds a Carnegie Mellon professor to its board of directors
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI has announced a new appointment to its board of directors: Zico Kolter. Kolter, a professor and director of the machine learning department at Carnegie Mellon, predominantly focuses his research on AI safety. This makes him an “invaluable technical director for [OpenAI’s] governance,” OpenAI writes in a post on its official blog. AI safety has […]

item.title: Spotify and Epic Games call Apple’s revised DMA compliance plan ‘confusing,’ ‘illegal’ and ‘unacceptable’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Count Spotify and Epic Games among the Apple critics who are not happy with the iPhone maker’s newly revised compliance plan for the European Union’s Digital Markets Act (DMA). Shortly after Apple announced the updated version on Thursday, including loosened restrictions along with the addition of two more fees, Spotify shared a statement with TechCrunch […]

item.title: Thursday, the dating app that you can use only on Thursdays, expands to San Francisco
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Thursday seeks to shake up conventional online dating in a crowded market. The app, which recently expanded to San Francisco, fosters intentional dating by restricting user access to Thursdays. At midnight, all matches disappear. The idea is that by restricting usage to one day a week, potential matches will be encouraged to set up real-life meetings […]

item.title: Cohere co-founder Nick Frosst thinks everyone needs to be more realistic about what AI can and cannot do
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
AI companies are gobbling up investor money and securing sky-high valuations early in their life cycle. This dynamic has many calling the AI industry a bubble. Nick Frosst, a co-founder of Cohere, which builds custom AI models for enterprise customers, recently said on TechCrunch’s Found podcast that he doesn’t think the AI industry is in […]

item.title: Instagram is embracing the ‘photo dump’
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Instagram is rolling out the ability for users to add up to 20 photos or videos to their feed carousels, as the platform embraces the trend of “photo dumps.” Back in 2017, Instagram added the ability to post up to 10 photos or videos in one swipeable carousel post. Now, you can post double the […]
